thread.title: Convincing wins send Landwehr to state
thread.title_full: Convincing wins send Landwehr to state

title: Convincing wins send Landwehr to state
text:
Convincing wins send Landwehr to state The Star Press 11:54 p.m. EDT October 17, 2015 Buy Photo 23 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
It didn't matter if his opponent was another player, the wind, or the cold. 
Ian Landwehr toyed with all of them on his way to winning the Kokomo Regional for singles boys tennis. 
He defeated David Villarroel from South Adams 6-0, 6-0, and clinched the title by defeating Crawfordsville's Dane Baldwin 6-1, 6-0. 
On a day when the elements could be a factor, Landwehr didn't let less than perfect conditions hurt him. 
â€œIt was very windy and cold, so he used the wind to his advantage. He put pressure on his opponents and moving them around and not letting them do a whole lot," Yorktown coach Bob Darby said. "When hitting into the wind, it takes a lot of effort and footwork to actually do well. He did an excellent job, he was hitting good shots into the wind that threw his opponent off." 
Darby watched Baldwin earlier in the day during his first match. He saw a strong forehand, backhand and serve. Once the regional portion of the postseason is reached, every opponent is of high quality, meaning there can be no points taken off if a player wants to win. 
The win improves Landwehr to 23-1 on the season, and he'll play in the state finals on Friday, and if necessary, Saturday. There, he could face Richmond's Eric Hollingsworth, the only player to defeat him in the regular season since his freshman year. 
"I was not expecting the match to end at 6-1, 6-0. Ian just really took the wind out of his sails," Darby said." It was very well played and better than what I was expecting with the bad weather." 23 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://tspne.ws/1LB2M7t TOP VIDEOS
